1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: A behind the scenes look alongside the underground army that keeps the Tube running as it travels the equivalent of six times around the world every day. Join Charlotte and others on the team as they work to keep the Piccadilly Line running despite unexpected maintenance issues.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: At Victoria Station, a hub that sees nearly 600 passengers a minute, the ticket office is closing to make way for a new automated ticketing system. These contactless ticketing terminals are just one of the many changes coming to the Tube to bring the world's oldest Underground railway into the 21st Century.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: As Halloween arrives, the Tube prepares for one of its busiest nights of the year. Tensions run high as crowded stations are temporarily closed to prevent tragedy. Massive engineering projects at one of the Tube's busiest stations adds to the jumble.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: At Bank Station, customer service assistants must face an epidemic of dropped phones, wallets, and Oyster Cards on the tracks. Trains are forced to come to a halt as they retrieve items. Sometimes even the staff lose an item or two on the tracks.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: With one million passengers expected, Tube staff prepare to ring in the New Year on the only night of the year when trains run for 24 hours. Hundreds of staff have come together to ensure operations go as smoothly as possible but they never know what might upend the balance. The Underground is on high alert following the terrorist attacks in the Paris Metro.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: A crackdown begins on fare dodgers who cost the Tube nearly Â£34 million per year. At Angel station staff face a hostile passenger who refuses to pay his fare.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: As terror threats rise to levels never before seen in the Tube, more than one thousand new staff members join the team. Changes abound to ensure the safety of passengers and staff alike.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: As the population of London continues to soar at a record high of eight million people, the Tube continues to prepare for the future. 100ft below Bond Street, new passenger tunnels are already under construction to handle the rising demand.

imdb.plot outline: Carrying nearly five million passengers per day, the London Tube is one of the world's oldest and busiest metro systems in the world. Today the Tube is undergoing a complete overhaul that is long overdue. Take a behind the scenes look into the daily lives of drivers, emergency personnel, operations managers, and many others among the near twenty thousand employees of this massive rail system, as they navigate the evolution of the London Tube.
imdb.title: The Tube: Going Underground
plot: Take a behind the scenes look into the daily lives of the nearly twenty thousand employees of the London Tube over the course of one year as they navigate changes while the Tube begins a major overhaul to handle record breaking demands.::Ian Scheil
